intro: Agrostemma githago var. minor, commonly known as lesser goatweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is an annual herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
